comments:
When deploying my plugin using the export wizard I am facing the following
stacktrace:

java.lang.IllegalAccessError: tried to access method org.apache.tools.ant.
Project.fireBuildFinished(Ljava/lang/Throwable;)V from class org.eclipse.ant.
internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner
at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.
fireBuildFinished(InternalAntRunner.java:820)
at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRunner.
java:699)
at org.eclipse.ant.internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner.run(InternalAntRunner.
java:433)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
at org.eclipse.ant.core.AntRunner.run(AntRunner.java:355)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.
runScript(FeatureExportJob.java:335)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.
doExport(FeatureExportJob.java:215)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.PluginExportJob.
doExports(PluginExportJob.java:56)
at org.eclipse.pde.internal.ui.wizards.exports.FeatureExportJob.
run(FeatureExportJob.java:116)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:67)

Any ideas or workarounds?
Which version of Ant are you using?

I can only reproduce this problem if I set ANT_HOME to Ant earlier than 1.5.*
Do you really need to still build on such an old build of Ant?

I have double checked the version of ANT I am using. ANT_HOME points to version 
1.6.2 and also the ant-plugin used by Eclipse IDE 3.1 indicates ANT version 
1.6.2.

Can you come up with any more ideas?

Go to Window>Preferences>Ant>Runtime>Classpath
Hit Restore Defaults
Attempt to export

I will rollback the change that breaks building with Ant 1.4* (the use of the 
now public but then protected fireBuildFinished() in the Project)

More changes than I thought here to succeed doing builds on Ant 1.4.1

Changes to the InternalAntRunners:
for fireBuildFinished and fireBuildStarted we check the Ant version and act 
accordingly. Same in parseBuildFile

In the remote InternalAntRunner we now ignore the setting of input handlers if 
you are running an older Ant version that does not support it since by default 
the infrastructure adds an inputhandler.

Note that exporting will still fail as the export wizard is generating Ant 
buildfiles that are using later Ant version constructs.

Changes also to RemoteAntMessages.properties

Please verify Kevin.

traces.message: tried to access method org.apache.tools.ant. Project.fireBuildFinished(Ljava/lang/Throwable;)V from class org.eclipse.ant. internal.core.ant.InternalAntRunner
